oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Quilt
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This quilt was made by Katherine Hicks, born in 1847. The design is a 9-patch within a 25-patch block. The top contains approximately 4361 pieces. She made the quilt when she was 13 years old, which was approximately 1860. The reverse portion of the quilt includes an inscription created in 1937. The donation was made to the Red Cross Commission in Bristol, Tennessee/Virginia for use in Louisville when she was 90 years old. She had never used the quilt herself.
